S0011-d-02-24-98-SSAM.Narrative: TRAIN, SORE 2 -24, CONSISTING OF 2 LOCOMOTIVES AND 54 LOADS WAS OPERATING UNDER CTC ON EMPIRE MINE TRACK AT APPROXIMATELY 5 MPH.   WHILE PULLING THE LOADS FROM THE TAIL TRACK, THE CONDUCTOR LOOKED BACK TO INSPECT HIS TRAIN AND SAW THAT THE 2ND LOCOMOTIVE HAD DERAILED.  ENGINEER WAS TOLD TO " PLUG 'EM "  AND AIR WENT INTO EMERGENCY AT THE SAME TIME. INVESTIGATION INTO THE INCIDENT REVEALED THAT 1LOCOMOTIVE AND 3 CARS DERAILED ON A PILE OF ORE PELLETS THAT HAD LEAKED OUT OF A CAR AND ONTO THE TRACK AT THE FROG.  LSI DOES NOT OWN THIS TRACK BUT REPAIRS IT FOR THE EMPIRE MINE.  THEY WERE NOT GOING TO BE SUBMITTING A REPORT AS THEY ARE A CONTRACTOR FOR THE MINE.  TRACK DAMAGE IS SHOWN.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

98003-d-02-16-98-SCXF.Primary Accident Cause: Use of brakes, other (Provide detailed description in narrative)
98003-d-02-16-98-SCXF.Narrative: UPON HEARING THE RADIO TRANSMISSION, ENGINEER TURNED AROUND AND LOOKED AT THE APPROACHING ENGINES.REALIZING THEY WERE TOO CLOSE TO STOP, AND RECEIVING A SECOND FRANTIC CALL ON THE RADIO, HE ATTEMPTED TO MOVE THE ENGINES FORWARD TO AVOID IMPACT.  CONDUCTOR STOOD UP FROM HIS SEAT, TURNED AROUND ANDBENT DOWN TO LOOK THROUGH THE REAR WINDOW ON THE CONDUCTOR'S SIDE.  AT THIS MOMENT, IMPACT BETWEEN THE TWO ENGINE CONSISTS OCCURRED.  ENGINEER HAD GOTTEN THE ENGINE BRAKES TO RELEASE AND FORWARD MOVEMENT HAD JUST BEGUN.  THE JOINT CSXT AND SCFE COMMITTEE ASCERTAINED THE CAUSE OF THE COLLISION WAS FULLY CSXT ENGINEER 'S FAILURE TO CONTROL THE TRAIN IN HIS CHARGE.  HE HAD SET THE INDEPENDENT BRAKE AT FULL APPLICATION, AND WHEN IT WAS APPARENT THAT COLLISION WAS IMMINENT, HE REVERSED THE ENGINE CONSIST AND ADVACED THE THROTTLE TO NUMBER FOUR POSITION.  THE SPEED AT IMPACT WAS ESTIMATED AT FIVE TOEIGHT MILES PER HOUR.  THE TRAIN AIR BRAKE WAS NOT SET PRIOR TO IMPACT.  THE CSXT ENGINE CONSIST HAD SLID ON DAMP RAIL FOR APPROXIMATELY 250 FEET BEFORE IMPACT.  THE WHEELS ON CSXT 5900 WERE FOUND TOHAVE CONDEMNING FLAT SPOTS.NoneNoneNone

980201D-d-02-03-98-ALQS.Narrative: A TRAIN OF 17 LOADS AND 17 EMPTIES WERE EN ROUTE, PULLING IN A NORTH DIRECTION DESTINED FOR CSX INTERCHANGE FOR OUTBOUND.  13 LOADED CARS WERE BEYOND THE SPOT WHERE THE DERAILMENT OCCURRED.  THE FIRSTCAR TO DERAIL WAS A LOADED CAR OF TIN PLATE STEEL ATSF 621620 IT APPEARED THAT ONE WHEEL OF THE SOUTH TRUCKS DROPPED WHILE THE OTHERS STAYED ON THE RAIL.  THE TRAIN CONTINUED THAT WAY FOR APPROX. 10RAIL LENGTHS.  THEN THE RAIL SPREAD AND STARTED TURNING THE LEADING CAR ATSF 621620 TRAVELED ON THEWEB OF THE RAIL.  THE NORTH SET OF TRUCKS ON THIS PIECE OF EQUIPMENT DID NOT DERAIL.  BEFORE THE MOVEMENT WAS STOPPED 7 CARS HAD DERAILED.  5 LOADS AND 2 EMPTIES.  EQUIPMENT INVOLVED:  ATSF 620621, ATSF 621819, NW 189963, NW 189808, CSXT 702977 - LOADS.  CSXT 484943, CSXT 708473 - EMPTIES.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone
